thread.title: Stunned Flybe passenger captures heart-stopping moment ‘engine failed’ mid-flight forcing plane into emergency landing
thread.title_full: Stunned Flybe passenger captures heart-stopping moment ‘engine failed’ mid-flight forcing plane into emergency landing

author: jshammas
title: Stunned Flybe passenger captures heart-stopping moment ‘engine failed’ mid-flight forcing plane into emergency landing
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A FLYBE plane has had to make an emergency landing in Glasgow after an engine failed while battling intense gusts from Storm Doris. 
Flight BE783 from Glasgow to Birmingham had to return to Scotland after the dramatic mid-air emergency this morning. John A. MacInnes / Press Scotland One of the plane’s propellers appeared to have stalled mid-air 
Passenger John MacInnes tweeted about the incident as the flight began returning to Glasgow. 
He wrote: “Oh s***. Number one engine has failed and wee’re returning to Glasgow for an emergency landing.” 
Mr MacInnes later wrote: “Down safe n’ sound thanks to the professionalism of our pilots. 
“Excellent flying from I believe two Former RAF pilots.” 
— John A MacInnes (@pressscotland) February 23, 2017 Squawk 7700: Flight #BE783 from Glasgow to Birmingham has declared an emergency and returns to Glasgow pic.twitter.com/RQyGiXC1Fe 
— Breaking Flight News (@FlightBreaking) February 23, 2017 
Flybe have been contacted for comment. Plane tilts from side-to-side as it lands in windy Storm Doris weather at Leeds-Bradford airport 
As the plane begins its descent, it can be seen being turned sideways by gusts. 
Thankfully the pilot manages to pull off the awkward landing by turning the nose of the plane straight just moments before it touches the runway. 
Today commuters are being warned not to make unnecessary journeys with widespread reports of flights being grounded and speed limits imposed on trains. Related stories it's doris day!
